metadata.Title: CVE-2016-8862 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The AcquireMagickMemory function in MagickCore/memory.c in ImageMagickbefore 7.0.3.3 allows remote attackers to have unspecified impact via acrafted image, which triggers a memory allocation failure.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-8862` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.3
imagemagick-common - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.3
libmagick++5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.3
libmagickcore5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.3
libmagickcore5-extra - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.3
libmagickwand5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.3
perlmagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.3').
